meanings.definition: To be a perfect example of something.
meanings.sent1: The student epitomizing hard work always finishes assignments on time.
meanings.sent2: She is epitomizing dedication by practicing the piano every day.
meanings.sent3: The cat epitomizing laziness refused to chase the mouse.
meanings.sent4: His painting is epitomizing beauty with its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The shining star epitomizing brilliance captivated the audience.

meanings.sent1: The national flag epitomizing freedom waved proudly in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The dove epitomizing peace is a common symbol in many cultures.
meanings.sent3: The clown epitomizing happiness made everyone laugh with his silly antics.
meanings.sent4: Her smile epitomizing joy brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse epitomizing guidance helped ships navigate safely through the storm.

meanings.definition: To embody the essence of something.
meanings.sent1: The old tree epitomizing strength stood tall despite the harsh weather.
meanings.sent2: The ancient artifact epitomizing history was carefully preserved in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The cozy cabin epitomizing comfort was the perfect retreat for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: His words epitomizing wisdom resonated with everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The melody epitomizing nostalgia brought tears to her eyes.
